block.p: Gwen Edith Kinkead, a writer, and John Harris Lipscomb, a producer of television documentaries, were married yesterday at the Union Church in Pocantico Hills, N.Y., by the Rev. William B. Doster, a Presbyterian minister.
The bride, who is keeping her name, is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Eugene F. Kinkead of Nyack, N.Y. Her husband is the son of Mr. and Mrs. James C. Lipscomb of Tarrytown, N.Y.

The bride is a magna cum laude graduate of Harvard University and received a first-class degree in English literature from Cambridge University. Her father is a writer for The New Yorker. Her mother, Katharine Kinkead, is a retired New Yorker writer.

The bridegroom, who has been the skipper for a number of Atlantic and Pacific voyages, and his father work together as documentary producers. The bridegroom's mother, Roberte Lipscomb, retired from Sarah Lawrence College, where she taught French and French literature.
